intro: Cyrtopera stachyodes, commonly known as the velvetleaf or stachyodes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, warm environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Cyrtopera stachyodes is also known for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
